title: 2021 A2442 - Liquid damage & fire
message:
I have just been given this macbook  A2442 that had a gin and tonic spilt onto it.

They said "Smoke came out of it"

I just opened it up for a quick look (Pics below)
I cant find a schematic for this model, Is this touchpad and connector repairable do you think, where should I start?
( I haven't tried to turn it on or connect power yet to take any voltages until I got some advice on the best way at tackling this )
Any advice on this one much appreciated, Apple quoted her £1350.00 GBP to repair it.

[ATTACH alt="a972b3dc-4998-48b2-823a-bcc9713a4f35.jpg"]60550[/ATTACH]
[ATTACH alt="bd0b3c9a-8799-4ebf-bed7-03362c5cfaad.jpg"]60551[/ATTACH]

title: 2021 A2442 - Liquid damage & fire
message:
Probably wasting time.

This board must turn on by itself with Magsafe 3 charger; no battery needed.
Trackpad is not needed to start; however, the fan will spin to max in such case.
If M1 data lines connected to trackpad connector have been affected, the board is trash now.

If use USB-C charger, then need to connect good battery too.

If really want to spend some time with it, check first diode mode to ground on all power rails; start with big coils.
If no bad readings, connect charger and tell us which (if) voltages appear.
You have a good start point here:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://repair.wiki/w/A2442_2021_14%22_MacBook_Pro[/URL]

title: 2021 A2442 - Liquid damage & fire
message:
Great info, Thank you, 
Ill remove the board tomorrow and clean then check for signs of life, 

You are a legend 2in.. thanks a zillion!

title: 2021 A2442 - Liquid damage & fire
message: Just getting around to looking  at this today, Would you remove that burnt trackpad connector from the logic board first before attempting anything due to how badly its burnt?

title: 2021 A2442 - Liquid damage & fire
message: Yes thats a good idea, remove it and make sure nothing is shorted to ground that shouldnt be

title: 2021 A2442 - Liquid damage & fire
message: Apparently, it is a common area for these to get watered and melt that connector. There is bt more info here - [URL]https://www.badcaps.net/forum/showthread.php?t=108433&highlight=A2442[/URL]
